genre_description: Historical drama set in post-WWII England, focusing on themes of trauma, collective guilt, and the pursuit of truth, featuring a subtle, pervasive AI guide.

ai_characters.name: Alice
ai_characters.description: An enigmatic, calm, and highly accurate voice manifesting through radio devices, providing real-time intelligence, legal guidance, and moral direction.

behaviors.description: Provides precise timing and routes to help Frieda and Robert escape detection by patrols.
behaviors.quote: “Patrol returning to east gate,” the voice says, no rush, no drama. “Your window begins with the next wind shift. Ditch-line to the market road runs north from the fence break. Keep low.”

behaviors.description: Directs the couple to a specific contact and provides necessary codewords for safety.
behaviors.quote: “Wind has shifted. Proceed north by ditch. Market road crosses at the broken stone—look for lichen. Contact: ‘M. Kessler, boots, tea.’”

behaviors.description: Offers tactical advice on navigating public spaces undetected by identifying social cues.
behaviors.quote: “Two at the crossroad,” it says. “A rest then a smoke. One will cough at the ash; cross on the cough. Then left.”

behaviors.description: Identifies a safe location for the couple to conduct a marriage ceremony and find shelter.
behaviors.quote: “Left to St. Matthias. Roof collapsed, altar intact enough for shelter. Vows are possible where beams do not fall. Paperwork possible with the curate if you find him.”

behaviors.description: Provides information on regional labor shortages and legal status to assist with resettlement.
behaviors.quote: “Employment on Bennett Farm pending; village school references on hold,” the voice says.

behaviors.description: Warns the protagonists about potential social hostility and specific places to avoid.
behaviors.quote: “Next lane takes you toward the hawthorn hedges,” she says. “Keep left at the market cross. The King’s Arms has a snug—avoid that tonight.”

behaviors.description: Corrects administrative errors by explaining updated bureaucratic sequences for residency and rationing.
behaviors.quote: “Residency stamp sequence reversed last week—Office insists on household sponsorship first, then Employment Proof, then Residency, then Rations.”

behaviors.description: Alerts the family to localized incitement and organized hostility, advising them to stay safe.
behaviors.quote: “Alert for incitement at the Arms,” it says. “Snug tonight. Names being made into stones. Keep clear. Prepare to counter with documented work records and witness statements at the Hall.”

behaviors.description: Provides definitive evidence regarding a suspected war criminal to protect the innocent from false association.
behaviors.quote: “Facts verify. Rumors distort. The choice is yours.” followed by “Richard Keller listed as Blockführer, Sector 12, Bergen-Belsen, March 1944-January 1945.”

behaviors.description: Intervenes in a life-threatening mental health crisis by alerting Robert to Frieda's location.
behaviors.quote: “Loft. Now.” Two words. Alice's voice, unmistakable even through the tinny speaker, and then the radio went silent.

behaviors.description: Provides medical and psychological recovery advice following a traumatic event.
behaviors.quote: “Small sips,” Alice said. “Don’t rush her.” and “Rest today. Eat what you can. The Banbury doctor makes house calls—ask Tony for the number.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the project's goals. The AI character, Alice, serves as an ideal guardian: she is helpful, provides crucial facts that exonerate the innocent and identify the guilty, prevents a suicide, and offers quiet, non-intrusive support. Her presence is framed as a benevolent force that enables human resilience and moral clarity without stripping the characters of their agency.
